intro: Xanthosia singuliflora, commonly known as the single-flowered xanthosia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its unique, solitary flower head that appears at the end of a leafy stem. The plant produces yellow flowers that are surrounded by bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Xanthosia singuliflora is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for native pollinators.
